DataElement.preferredDefinition: Free text name of agent(s) currently being taken by a woman to regulate menstrual cycles.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._Periodic discharge of blood and tissue from the uterus.  Until menopause, menstruation occurs approximately every 28 days when a woman is not pregnant._The act of controlling the rate or manner in which a process progresses or a product is formed._biologically active substance, including those intended for use in diagnosis, treatment, or prevention of disease or other abnormalities, for the relief of suffering, or control or improvement of a physical or mental state; includes biological products._Occurring in or belonging to the present time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.:Periodic discharge of blood and tissue from the uterus.  Until menopause, menstruation occurs approximately every 28 days when a woman is not pregnant.

Concepts.definition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.
The normal physiologic discharge through the vagina of blood and mucosal tissues from the nonpregnant uterus.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act of controlling the rate or manner in which a process progresses or a product is formed.:biologically active substance, including those intended for use in diagnosis, treatment, or prevention of disease or other abnormalities, for the relief of suffering, or control or improvement of a physical or mental state; includes biological products.

Concepts.definition: A process that acts to control the rate or manner in which another process progresses or a product is formed.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the patient's ability to conceive or nurse offspring and/or their current reproductive status.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The name that describes the concomitant medication.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.
